definition: to return from a rewarding journey
Manchu ethnic group
to fill/full/filled/packed/fully/completely/quite/to reach the limit/to satisfy/satisfied/contented
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: Waiting for a fight, waiting for a rewarding experience of the attack.
sentences.chinese: 等待着一場戰鬥，等待着一次滿載而歸的出擊。

sentences.english: Integrating business and leisure tours, we will ensure you a rewarding journey in Jiaxing.
sentences.chinese: 集休閒與商務一體的嘉興之旅，相信會讓你滿載而歸。

sentences.english: Is the governor of Illinois Shanghai also return fully loaded.
sentences.chinese: 是次伊州州長來滬同樣滿載而歸。

sentences.english: Can be said to be disappointing from fruitful.
sentences.chinese: 可以說是掃興而來滿載而歸。

sentences.english: Wang Tai never sermonize but his students learn a lot from him.
sentences.chinese: 王駘從不說教，可是到他那學習的人卻都是滿載而歸。

sentences.english: In the distance, rewarding experience of the Muslim caravan was way back.
sentences.chinese: 在遠方，滿載而歸的穆斯林商隊正在返回的路上。

definition: to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
to feast one's eyes
different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
full to capacity/fully loaded
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to have one's wish fulfilled
guests feel at home (in a hotel, guest house etc)/a home away from home
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
to purchase/to buy/to do one's shopping/purchasing agent/buyer
elated
nice surprise/to be pleasantly surprised
taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
happy time/happy hour (in bars etc)
to sweep clean/to clean out
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
